subject: Home & DIY
title: Ice Dams and Roof Leaks
description: A 60-second lesson on Ice Dams and Roof Leaks.

hook.text: That beautiful row of icicles on your roof is actually a sign of damage happening right now above your head.

buildup.text: Heat leaking through a poorly insulated attic melts roof snow. Water runs down to the colder eaves and refreezes.

discovery.text: The ice dam blocks further meltwater, which pools behind it. Standing water seeps under shingles and into your ceiling.

twist.text: Chopping ice off treats the symptom but damages shingles. The real fix is air-sealing and insulating the attic.

climax.text: A well-insulated attic stays cold in winter‚Äîmatching outside temperature. No heat loss means no melting and no ice dams.

punchline.text: Pretty icicles mean your attic is failing.

quiz.question: What actually causes ice dams on a roof?
options: Heat escaping through the attic melts snow that refreezes at the eaves
Frozen gutters that prevent water drainage
Heavy snowfall that compresses into ice layers
